More Notes: Calculates change in consumer/producer surplus due to crop yield reduction and higher irrigation costs. Value not explicitly mentioned, assuming a neutral impact initially.

Calculates reduced load of vessels, more trips, increased travel times due to detours and increased waiting time at sluices, which all results in higher transport costs. Value not explicitly mentioned, assuming a neutral impact initially.

Costs of drought adaptation to maintain the supply reliability represents the economic impact of (future) droughts on drinking water supply. Value not explicitly mentioned, assuming a neutral impact initially.

Droughts may affect industrial use by deteriorating water quality. Costs of drought adaptation to maintain the supply reliability represents the economic impact of (future) droughts on industrial use. Value not explicitly mentioned, assuming a neutral impact initially.
Soil subsidence, instability of peat embankments, water quality, and biodiversity loss were monetized with a shadow price. Value not explicitly mentioned, assuming a neutral impact initially.
EAA used to compare measures with different lifespans, investments, and annual operational and maintenance costs. No specific numeric values provided on this page, representing a null value.
Monetized effects based on calculated change in drought risk were included in evaluating policy actions. No specific numeric values provided on this page, representing a null value.
Non-monetized effects provided by the stakeholders were included in evaluating policy actions. No specific numeric values provided on this page, representing a null value.

Based on the current drought risk estimated at EUR 372 million per year and the potential increase to EUR 611 million by 2050 under the Stoom scenario, the avoided impact is calculated by subtracting the current impact from the future impact under worst-case.
Policy action N-3 becomes cost-effective under the Stoom scenario mainly benefiting agriculture.
Negative impact on shipping from policy action N-3 under the Stoom scenario.
The value is not explicitly specified for drinking water, but it reduces the risk for drinking water. Setting to zero for completeness, but this should be improved with more information.
